homes_hear_details: Arizona has not yet launched its HOMES or HEAR rebate programs. The Arizona Department of Housing is the designated administering entity and is working with the U.S. Department of Energy on program design and implementation.
state_energy_office: Arizona Energy Office (within the Governor's Office)

income_thresholds.low_income_80_ami: For Arizona, 80% of Area Median Income varies by county. In Maricopa County (Phoenix metro), 80% AMI for a family of four is approximately $62,100.
income_thresholds.moderate_income_150_ami: For Arizona, 150% of Area Median Income in Maricopa County for a family of four is approximately $116,400.

net_metering: Arizona replaced traditional net metering with net billing (also called net export rate) for new solar customers as of 2017. Under the Arizona Corporation Commission decision, new solar customers receive a lower export rate for excess energy sent to the grid, which decreases over time. Grandfathered net metering customers retain their original rate structure for a set period.

state_tax_credits.name: Arizona Residential Solar and Wind Energy Systems Tax Credit
state_tax_credits.amount: 25% of the cost of the system, up to $1,000
state_tax_credits.eligible_items: Solar electric (PV), solar thermal/hot water, and wind energy systems for residential use
state_tax_credits.details: This is a personal income tax credit. The credit was historically higher but has been capped at $1,000. Unused credit can be carried forward for up to five years.

state_rebate_programs.name: Weatherization Assistance Program
state_rebate_programs.amount: Average expenditure of approximately $7,000-$8,000 per home
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Insulation, air sealing, duct repair, HVAC tune-ups, refrigerant charge correction, window shading
state_rebate_programs.details: Federally funded program for income-qualifying households. Arizona's program emphasizes cooling load reduction given the hot climate.

programs.name: Home Performance with ENERGY STAR
programs.amount: Up to $2,500 in rebates for comprehensive improvements
programs.eligible_items: Insulation, air sealing, duct sealing, HVAC upgrades, windows

programs.name: Cool Savings Rebate Program
programs.amount: Up to $500 for qualifying AC/heat pump systems
programs.eligible_items: High-efficiency air conditioners and heat pumps meeting minimum SEER2 requirements

programs.name: Shade Tree and Shade Screen Programs
programs.amount: Free shade trees (up to 2) or discounted shade screens
programs.eligible_items: Shade trees for eligible homes, exterior shade screens

programs.name: Rebates for Cool AC
programs.eligible_items: High-efficiency air conditioners and heat pumps, quality installation verification

programs.name: Heat Pump Water Heater Rebate
programs.eligible_items: ENERGY STAR certified heat pump water heaters

programs.name: Shade Tree Program
programs.eligible_items: Desert-adapted shade trees to reduce cooling costs

programs.name: Residential Energy Efficiency Rebates
programs.amount: Varies; up to $400 for HVAC, up to $250 for insulation
programs.eligible_items: High-efficiency air conditioners, heat pumps, insulation, duct sealing, shade screens
